subject: Ethics
title: How Data Brokers Profile You
description: A 60-second lesson on How Data Brokers Profile You.

hook.text: A company you've never heard of probably knows your income, health conditions, and political views.

buildup.text: Data brokers buy info from apps, stores, and public records, then stitch together detailed profiles of millions.

discovery.text: One broker, Acxiom, holds profiles on over 2.5 billion people, sorted into categories like 'struggling single mom.'

twist.text: You can't easily opt out. Many brokers lack public websites. They sell your profile to anyone willing to pay.
